content.question: (a) Describe the effect on an enzyme of an increase in environmental temperature above the optimum temperature range of the enzyme.

frqParts.text: (a) Describe the effect on an enzyme of an increase in environmental temperature above the optimum temperature range of the enzyme.

(b) Using the template in the space provided for your response, construct an appropriately labeled graph to represent the data in Table <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Determine whether there is a statistical difference in the amount of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> fixed by rubisco at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mi>째</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="40 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mi>째</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
(c) Based on the data, identify the temperature range at which the soybean leaves are producing the lowest amount of carbohydrate.

(d) Increased amounts of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere are correlated with increased global surface temperatures. Based on the data, predict how a surface temperature that continues to rise above <math alttext="40 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn><mi>째</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> most likely affects the amount of energy available to primary consumers in an ecosystem. Provide reasoning to justify your prediction. One model predicts that an increase in greenhouse gases will lead to a <math alttext="2 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>째</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> increase in average surface temperature on Earth. Based on the data from the experiment and the prediction of an increase in average surface temperature by the model, predict how the locations of plant species are expected to change over time.
